COPY RIGHT 1912 BY R L. POLK & CO.

PREFACE.

The publishers herewith submit their 1912 edition of the Columbus City Directory. The information contained in this volume has been carefully collected and from the system used, the result of long years of experience, the publishers are con fident that a degree of accuracy heretofore unattained, has been

reached. The canvass for the information contained in the Directory

is not confined to the corporate limits of the city, but includes all the adjacent surrounding territory including Girard, Phenix

City, and Bibb City. This issue of the Directory contains 17,156 individual

names. Using the multiple of 2\ to allow for names of women

and children not represented in its columns, the population is estimated at 42,890.

While this may not agree with the United States census just taken, it must be remembered that the directory canvass is more thorough and made by trained men, and is not con fined to the city limits proper, but includes all the immediate suburbs, which are practically part of the city.

Then there are the hundreds of people living in out-ofthe-way places and a considerable population, which must be sought for by the means which experience has suggested to the publishers and which does not come under the purview of the United States census.

Therefore, without casting any reflection on the United States census, the estimated population, as shown by the local directory, should be larger than the population shown by the government census.

The publishers desire to extend their thanks to the busi ness men of the city for the patronage which makes the directory a possibility and to the public in general for their co-operation in giving the canvassers and name-takers the necessary informa tion.

Respectfully, The Publishers.
